channel.title: Basic Geometry
channel.description:
Hey guys, I have the rest of my finals tomorrow and my brain is fried from studying. I am doing this review packet for Geometry and I cannot figure out this basic problem. I don't know why I can't figure it out, it's just not coming to me.
The Base of the triangle and the chord are parallel (I don't know if everyone knows that the arrow marks mean parallelism) I need to solve for x:
[img]http://oi58.tinypic.com/296jh3d.jpg[/img]
No need to thank me for this expertly drawn Triangle.
Anyways: the triangle is scalene
I have tried setting up proportions and other misc. things but I just can't think atm. Where do I need to start this problem at?

item.title: Basic Geometry
item.dc:creator: @lesterknome lesterknome
item.description:
@lesterknome wrote:

those two triangles are similar so 2x + 5 / x = 2x - 1 / x - 2.
(2x + 5)(x - 2) = (x)(2x - 1)
2x^2 - 4x + 5x - 10 = 2x^2 - x
x - 10 = -x
2x = 10
x = 5
wrekt

Read full topic
